snippet: An audit from the state comptroller’s office is the latest to reveal shortcomings in the preschool special education system, which serves about 60,000 children a year and costs $2 billion annually.
abstract: State comptroller's audit reveals that New York spends around $2 billion a year on preschool for children with disabilities, yet the State Education Department has not visited or audited a single contractor involved in the program since 2007; Comptroller Thomas P DiNapoli calls for a new and more effective system of oversight, noting that cases involving six contractors have already been referred to law enforcement agencies.
lead_paragraph: An audit from the state comptroller’s office is the latest to reveal shortcomings in the preschool special education system, which serves about 60,000 children a year and costs $2 billion annually.
